RAID

With RAID (starting from RAID 1), you can replicate data on multiple hard disks, to improve the server's data backup in the event of failure. Important: RAID 0 does not back up the data. For this reason, it is not recommended.
Partition size
This size is the space that can be taken up by your data.
Space used

The sizes will vary depending on the RAID you use. If you have a server with 2 hard disks, a RAID 1 duplicates the data from a partition on to the 2 disks, doubling the space used as a result. If one of the 2 disks becomes faulty, the data is not lost.
